title: Sols 4270-4272: Sample for SAM
summary: Earth planning date: Friday, Aug. 9, 2024 The focus for this three-sol weekend plan is delivering a portion of the Kings Canyon drill sample to SAM for Evolved Gas Analysis (EGA), following on from a successful CheMin analysis. The CheMin and SAM analyses, coupled with APXS and ChemCam analyses, will tell us about the composition […]

title: Moon to Mars Part I: Forging the Path
summary: At its core, the Artemis Program represents a new way of thinking in space exploration. NASA’s Moon to Mars objectives incorporate the Artemis Program as part of the roadmap to the Red Planet.

title: NASA to Provide Coverage of Progress 89 Launch, Space Station Docking
summary: NASA will provide live launch and docking coverage of a Roscosmos cargo spacecraft delivering nearly three tons of food, fuel, and supplies to the Expedition 71 crew aboard the International Space Station. The unpiloted Progress 89 spacecraft is scheduled to launch at 11:20 p.m. EDT, Wednesday, Aug. 14 (8:20 a.m. Baikonur time, Thursday, Aug. 15), […]

title: I trust NASA’s safety culture this time around, and so should you
summary: "The lessons of Columbia have not been forgotten."

title: The Next Full Moon is a Supermoon Blue Moon
summary: The Next Full Moon is a Supermoon, a Blue Moon; the Sturgeon Moon; the Red, Corn, Green Corn, Barley, Herb, Grain, or Dog Moon; Raksha Bandhan or Rakhi Purnima; and Tu B’Av.

title: Earth Educators Rendezvous with Infiniscope and Tour It
summary: At the Earth Educator’s Rendezvous, held July 15-19, 2024, NASA’s Infiniscope project from Arizona State University hosted a two-day workshop aimed at empowering Earth educators with the tools to design and build virtual tours (VTs). This hands-on session provided participants with a unique opportunity to experience first-hand how to create immersive virtual tours using Tour […]

title: NASA payload to fly on first Blue Origin lunar lander mission
summary: A NASA payload will hitch a ride to the moon on Blue Origin’s first lunar lander mission, scheduled to launch as soon as next March.

title: We must adopt sustainability in planetary exploration
summary: As humanity embarks on a new era of space exploration, of establishing permanent human bases on the moon and Mars, sustainability must become the bedrock of our exploration efforts beyond […]

title: ESA and Poland Test Fire Variable-Thrust Rocket Engine
summary: A Polish consortium has completed a Phase A static fire test campaign of a new variable-thrust rocket engine. The Throttleable Liquid Propulsion Demonstrator (TLPD) engine project is part of ESA’s Future Launchers Preparatory Programme. The Polish consortium developing the engine is led by the Łukasiewicz Research Network’s Institute of Aviation (Lukasiewicz-ILOT), which is also responsible […]

title: NASA watchdog finds quality control problems with Boeing SLS work
summary: NASA’s internal watchdog sharply criticized the work Boeing is doing on the next version of the Space Launch System, finding serious lapses in quality control.
